description: From ecclesiastical Latin theraphim, from Ancient Greek θεραφίν (theraphín), from Hebrew תְּרָפִים‎ (t'rafím, “household gods”).

entries.meaning: An idol or other image of reverence and divination among the ancient Hebrews; apparently especially a kind of household god.
examples: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father's.
